text:
I want you to imagine a board game
similar to that of

chess but one where hundreds and
hundreds of boards

are lined up back to back a game where
each move you make is equivalent to a

day's worth of time
this is a game with thousands of

possible moves
symbolizing the thousands of different

choices you can make
every day welcome to the game of life

now the fact of the matter is you are
playing this game

whether or not you're aware of it every
single day you are either making the

right moves
bringing you closer to a happy and

fulfilled life
or you are making the wrong moves

getting you further
from all this good stuff and closer to

all the pain
and suffering that the world has to

offer
now i got good news and bad news for you

the good news is that the game of life
is a rather long

game most players get to make around 28
000 moves that's about 79 years worth of

moves
before the game is over even more good

news
is the fact that you don't have to play

perfectly you can make plenty of
mistakes and as long as you make more

right
than wrong moves you'll still be winning

at the game of life you'll still be able
to find

happiness and to top that off there are
dozens of right moves that you can make

every day
so it's not like you have to figure out

exactly what to do
you just have to figure out one of the

many right things to do
and if you're able to make many right

moves in a row the benefits will start
to compound

and you will succeed at an astounding
rate

now let's talk about the bad news the
bad news

is if you make a bunch of wrong moves
and don't learn from those mistakes

if you continue to make the wrong
choices repeatedly

your life will take a turn for the worse
and you will find yourself

falling deep into a never ending pit
life can start to feel like hell on

earth if you consistently
make too many wrong moves now i want to

end this little thought experiment by
telling you about the best

news the best news is that anyone can
win at the game of life no matter how

behind you might feel
how many wrong moves you've been making

recently or what your current life
situation is like

you still have a very good shot at
finding happiness

and fulfillment in life the only
question is

how do you know how to make the right
moves

well there are three ways to do this the
first is through luck

sometimes we don't know what to do and
we just randomly choose what move to

make
and by pure chance it turns out that we

did the right thing
the second way is through mentors good

mentors are essentially people
who have been successfully playing the

game of life longer than you have
they can look over your shoulder at your

board and help you differentiate between
the right

and the wrong moves but good mentors are
far

and few if you have access to one
definitely try to nurture that

relationship
the third and final way to make the

right move is the most important
it is through wisdom which is when you

can tell the right from the wrong
all on your own this is the most crucial

of the three
because you got to be able to rely on

yourself at the end of the day
your mentors teachers and parents can't

hold your hand forever
and the great thing about wisdom is that

anyone can cultivate it
by studying three simple subjects the

first subject
is human behavior you need to study how

people think and behave
what will people most likely do in

certain scenarios
why do they do those things what are

some patterns that appear
over and over again in certain cultures

what do people want in life
you must study human nature because the

fact of the matter is
that we live in a world run by humans

humans are the only species on this
planet

capable of accomplishing great things
and the only ones capable of

bringing about mass destruction and if
you know how humans act

you can predict the future with far more
accuracy for example i know that humans

have a habit of procrastinating
as a species we don't like to take

action until the problem is so severe
that we can no longer ignore it just

look at how we reacted to the virus
we didn't really do anything until it

was already too late
and i had a feeling that this would

happen back in january when i first read
about the virus

and saw how america was responding to it
i realized that we would react too

slowly
so i made several moves based on this

prediction which allowed me to increase
my net worth by

50 percent in just a couple of months i
was able to make the right move

because i understand human behavior now
the question remains

how do you improve your understanding of
human behavior

well first and foremost you got to read
psychology books like the laws of human

nature by robert greene which breaks all
of it down

in extreme detail you can read certain
history books

like sapiens by yuval ferrari which will
give you insight on what humans have

done throughout history
and why and finally you can learn from

experience by exposing yourself to as
many human interactions as possible

which will allow you to become more
familiar with their patterns over time

of course you should probably wait until
the pandemic is over before doing this

the second subject you have to study are
the current events

now many people in the self-improvement
world will tell you that you should stay

as far away as possible from the news as
it will bring too much negativity into

your life
but i think that you should keep up with

the current events because it
essentially dictates the roles of the

game
let me explain just a year ago before we

had the pandemic we were essentially
playing a totally different game

what was considered to be the right
moves back in that world are totally

different
from the right moves in this world back

then you could still open a small
business with a physical location

and expect to do relatively well while
nowadays we all know that such a task is

practically impossible
if you were unaware of the current

events if you didn't know about the
pandemic

until it actually hit your neighborhood
and you decided to start a business with

a physical location
in january you would have been

absolutely screwed
on the other hand if you read about the

virus back in january like i did
then you would have realized that the

game was about to change
and that you should hold off on any

major decisions until you see how it
plays out

it is foolish to not read the news
because the world is constantly changing

if you are caught at the wrong place at
the wrong time

because you aren't aware of these
changes it can literally

be the worst move of your life imagine
being stuck in a country as its

government collapses
like we are currently seeing in multiple

places worldwide
you won't even have time to worry about

self-improvement because you'll have to
worry about surviving

now there is some truth to what people
say about the news if you spend too much

time reading it
it can definitely bring a lot of

negativity into your life
this is why i suggest that you either

update yourself just once a week or even
once every two weeks

if you feel like you are especially
sensitive or if you are like me and you

don't mind doing it daily
make sure to do it later on in the day

when you've already finished with all of
your work

so that it doesn't interfere with your
focus which is why this episode was

brought to you to help the guys over at
morning brew

morning brew is a free daily newsletter
that arrives in your email inbox from

mondays to saturdays
and simply put they update you on the

latest news in a fun and entertaining
way

this is great because it allows you to
keep up to date with current events

without spending hours
on actual news sites morning brew

compiles the most important news of the
day

into a simple and easy to read email
that you can consume

in less than five minutes last week they
covered the current drama going on in

the post office
they also provided me with some

statistics about how colleges are
operating

during the pandemic you can also
subscribe to some of their alternative

newsletters that focus on business
marketing

tech and much more morning brew is
completely free with no strings attached

all you have to do is click on the link
in the description box below

and enter your email and that's it
you'll start receiving a daily

newsletter
and you can unsubscribe at any time if

you guys want an easy way to keep up
with current events then i highly

suggest you to check them out
now back to the topic at hand the last

subject you need to study are the facts
of nature

this is basically understanding how
nature works things like physics

biology technology etc and you need to
study this because these things are

proven to be true
and will continue to be true no matter

what the circumstances are
we can predict that an apple will fall

when you drop it because of gravity
we can predict that a virus will spread

more rapidly nowadays because of
international air travel

we can predict that people will have
more health problems in cities with high

air pollution
these are just facts about how the world

works
now how does this translate into making

the right move in life
well i'll give you an example based on

what i've learned about the climate i
predict

global warming will cause sea levels to
rise much faster

than people think it will and if i was
someone who planned on investing in real

estate to grow my wealth
and if i lived in a place like new york

city or the southern part of florida
i would be absolutely screwed if i

doubled down
and started purchasing property in those

areas because chances are
in a couple of years my properties will

get flooded and i'll lose a ton of money
knowing this i can invest in real estate

in other areas that are less likely to
be affected by climate change

which has a higher chance of being the
right move

now it can be a bit hard to study the
laws of nature because most of us are

not scientists
which is why the best alternative is to

consume content by people who specialize
in specific fields

but it's also important to note that
you'll find people who support both

sides
most scientists believe in climate

change but there are still some
that do not in these cases it's crucial

to listen to both sides of the argument
and see who backs their claims

with facts as compared to emotions the
side with more evidence is usually right

although sometimes the evidence can be
made up so you do have to do a decent

amount of research
you can also test to see if what they're

saying is true for the rising sea level
example

you can just look up the amount of ice
in the arctic once you do you'll see

that it is at record lows this year
which supports the idea that climate

change is in fact happening
and that's it make sure to study human

nature current events and the laws of
nature extensively

to increase your chances of making the
right moves in the game of life

if you can do this you will be able to
find more happiness in life

and you will also be able to avoid
unnecessary pain and suffering

i hope you guys found this video helpful
and besides that guys stay tuned
